title: Email deep link for showing stripe restricted notice
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The email deep link for stripe restricted campaign is not working correctly.

### Steps to reproduce

Follow the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta) which should open the Wallet screen with correct bank account settings. 

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?


When following the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta), it will open the Wallet screen with incorrect bank account settings. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

When following the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta), it will open the Wallet screen with correct bank account settings. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

wrong:
![image](/uploads/24d5a24cb9b69aee23a0650855f4f727/image.png)

right:
![image](/uploads/2af06b495d1eb0384e71e5d8e7f36d42/image.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Create UI entry point for in-app user verification
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Create the UI entry point in the home screen for in-app user verification.

## What needs to be done

- create a widget in the in-app user verification module, which will be displayed in the home screen between the ,, and the news feed, as per [UI design](https://www.figma.com/file/buCViQPMNyQUNCdtDYUTbL/In-App-User-Verification?node-id=308%3A1321&t=I7n8h64U4ZiemLJt-0)
- create a screen in the in-app user verification module, to navigate from the widget as per the U design
- link the in-app verification process initiation with the continue button of the above screen

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

https://www.figma.com/file/buCViQPMNyQUNCdtDYUTbL/In-App-User-Verification?node-id=314%3A1541&t=I7n8h64U4ZiemLJt-0

## Personas

Developers

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

AC1:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] WHEN I navigate to home screen
- [ ] THEN I will see a widget prompting for in-app verification 

AC2:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am a verified user
- [ ] WHEN I navigate to home screen
- [ ] THEN I will not see the widget prompting for in-app verification 

AC3:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I navigate to home screen 
- [ ] AND I see the widget prompting for in-app verification 
- [ ] WHEN I press on the Verify button
- [ ] THEN I will navigate to the Verify Channel screen 

AC4:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] AND the `I agree to Terms` checkbox is off
- [ ] THEN the `Continue` button on the top-right is disabled

AC5:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] WHEN I check the `I agree to Terms` checkbox (on)
- [ ] THEN the `Continue` button on the top-right will be enabled

AC6:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] AND the `I agree to Terms` checkbox is no
- [ ] WHEN I press the `Continue` button on the top-right 
- [ ] THEN I navigate to the in-app verification initiation process screen


## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Supermind settings minimum values should be pulled from config
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Min Supermind values aren't taken from config in Supermind settings - this means that now the engine is being updated for https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/merge_requests/1188, mobile does not reflect these changes (see screenshot)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Point at either the branch for https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/merge_requests/1188 or whatever env that change is released to.
2. Go to Supermind settings and try to set a value of 1 for cash. 

### Platform information 

Mobile

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Shows a $10 min when config states it should be 2.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should update based upon config.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/88db2534c2f40a05c3a87921a7f1ff48/image.png)

### Possible fixes

It appears to be hardcoded here:

https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/blob/f598d0419d482d58867a085fd33f316db481e089/src/settings/screens/SupermindSettingsScreen.tsx#L144

Value can be grabbed from https://www.minds.com/api/v1/minds/config (upermind.min_thresholds.min_cash / min_usd)

![image](/uploads/0f3ea9ed2a64d2510833c58a5058737c/image.png)

title: Error message is unclear when accepting a supermind offer that is looking for image or video replies
description:
### Summary

Error message should be clear that you need to upload an image or a video when accepting a supermind offer that expects an image or a video. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Login as user1. 
2. Send a supermind offer with image/video reply to user2. 
3. Login as user2.
4. Accept the offer.
5. Do not add image/video in supermind reply.
6. Press send.
7. Error message appears that is not descriptive. 

### Platform information 

4.30 RC - Browserstack S22

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Error message is not clearly explaining why supermind is not working. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Error message should be clear as in web. Please follow similar text as web. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/55c5abef9d9ac021ecc7d7fc127b05a2/image.png)

description:

### Summary

title: Supermind video replies not working on ios
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When responding to a Supermind video reply on the mobile app, if you attempt to record the video directly from the Minds composer, it returns an error when you try to post the video.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Send a video reply supermind to a channel you own
2. Reply to the supermind offer on the mobile app
3. Capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
4. Try to post the reply and you get an error

### Platform information 

iOS.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- GIVEN THAT I reply to a supermind offer
- AND I capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
- AND I try to post the reply
- THEN the video in the reply cannot be played

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- GIVEN THAT I reply to a supermind offer
- AND I capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
- AND I post the reply
- THEN the video in the reply should play correctly

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/df80ed44655ddf5256300b2434df2ab4/image.png)

### Possible fixes

It only happens with supermind, so i think the supermind logic does not think the video is there if its recorded directly in the app
aka you can record and post a video in the composer from regular composer.

title: Change compose to create and add drawer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Minimize friction for users to create and monetize our products. 

<details><summary>Inspiration</summary>



![sc](/uploads/0df8cc4c4c0c207e02625656c6945a8f/sc.jpeg)

![Screenshot_20221101-215006_Twitter](/uploads/b98d066c58af7774b55234561b219e8a/Screenshot_20221101-215006_Twitter.jpg)

![Screenshot_20221101-214808_YouTube](/uploads/5e93ff3a135cdbefe6c4e7b526a2a266/Screenshot_20221101-214808_YouTube.jpg)

</details>

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- Change Compose to Create
- Spawn drawer component which lets a user select: Post, Monetized Post, Boost, Supermind, Story, Group, Photo, Video, Gif, Blog, Membership


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

Create modal

![Screenshot_1677839805](/uploads/3140155f13a58c3b443b535b2594e011/Screenshot_1677839805.png)

Composer

![Screenshot_1677839927](/uploads/50c8c51bf441974d9f18fd3fac4896dc/Screenshot_1677839927.png)

Audience selector

![Screenshot_1677839863](/uploads/b3dba98c9a01a4ed6746bd17228bfd61/Screenshot_1677839863.png)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- Given I'm composing the first time
  - When I press the [+] tab
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And a text hint saying I can long-press on compose button to get this popup
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - When I Long Press the [+] tab
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - When I press the [+] tab
  - Then I see the post composer (as of now)
  - And I can see the caret down next to New Post in the title
  - And I can create a new post

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - And I press the [+] tab
  - And I see the post composer open
  - When I tap on the caret down next to New Post in the title
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm composing a post
  - When I press the "Public" button next to the send button
  - I will see the audience selector

- Given I'm composing a post
  - When open the audience selector
  - Then I will see the "Public" option which will create a normal post
  - And I will see a minds+ option on Android

- Given I'm composing a post as a non-plus user
  - When I open audience selector
  - And I press minds+
  - Then I will be prompted to upgrade to minds plus
  - And when I finish upgrading
  - Then I will see a terms and agreements sheet
  - When I press "I agree to the terms"
  - Then minds+ will be selected
  - And When I press "Done"
  - And I submit the post
  - Then the post will be minds+

- Same AC as above but with a plus user should not upgrade to prompt but should show the terms and agreements

- Given I'm composing a post as a new user
  - When I open audience selector
  - I will see a short description of memberships and how it can be useful to me
  - When I press "Get started"
  - Then I will be able to create a membership and go back and select that membership
  - And I create the post
  - And that post will be in that membership

- Same AC as above but with a user with existing memberships should just show the memberships without prompting to create a new one. It should also have a "manage" button that allows the user to manage their memberships.

- Given I'm composing a post as a user who is a member of one or more groups 
  - When I open audience selector
  - Then I should see all the groups I'm a member of
  - And I should be able to select any of them
  - And post to that group

- Same AC as above but if the user is not a member of a group, they will see no option

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the "Post" option
  - Then the composer opens normally

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Monetized post option (available only on android)
  - Then I will see the composer and the audience selector open at the same time
  - And the audience selector only has Memberships and Minds+ options available

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Boosted post
  - Then composer opens normally
  - When I create a post
  - Then I will see the Boost screen open (animation: slide-from-right)
  - And I can successfully boost that post
  - If I close the Boost screen, then I should not see the composer

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Supermind option
  - Then the composer and supermind composer open together and I will be able to create a supermind request
  - and post will be created accordingly, successfully

- All of the above actions related to Create modal should also work from within the composer 

- Given the experiment is off, I should see the normal composer without these features

- Given the experiment is on, I should NOT see the monetize option in the composer poster options
- **Debatable**: Given the experiment is on, I should NOT see the supermind icon in the composer bottom bar

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Prompt users to connect a bank account when accepting cash Supermind offer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

As Minds, I want to send cash Supermind offers to creators, regardless of whether or not they've previously connected a bank account.

As a user, I want to accept a cash Supermind offer and collect the offer.

## What needs to be done

Handle cash Supermind offer charges when the recipient has not already connected a bank account. https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/3409

Add a step into the Supermind reply flow when the offer is for cash and the recipient has not previously connected to a bank account.

1. View Supermind console
2. Click accept on a cash offer
3. `New`: Prompt to connect a bank account
4. On connect, open the stripe web page in internal browser and complete enrollment
4. On success, compose the reply
5. On failure to connect prompt again

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

In the Supermind console, show a toast message when a user attempts to accept a cash Supermind offer and they have not yet connected their account:

> `To accept this offer, you must first add your bank information.`

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Given a recipient has not previously connected a bank account, and they've received a cash Supermind offer, when they click to accept the offer, then they are prompted to connect their bank account via toast error message
- [ ] Given the Stripe connect account has been connected, then the recipient can continue to compose a Supermind reply.
- [ ] Given that the user has no connected bank account, then open the stripe web page in internal browser
- [ ] Given that the user complete the connected bank account in stripe web site, then he can dismiss the browser and continue to compose Supermind
- [ ] Given that the user does not complete the connected bank account in stripe web site, when he dismiss the browser then he'll be prompted to add a new bank account.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

description:
### Summary

Supermind replies and remind toasters say supermind request has been sent successfully. The toaster message should be updated when reminding or replying to a supermind post. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds app.
2. Send a supermind post to a user.
3. Login with other use and reply to that supermind post. 
4. Reply/Remind a supermind post. 

### Platform information 

All platforms - 4.29.1 RC

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

After replying or reminding a supermind post, the toaster message does not say you replied or reminded. Instead says that your supermind request was sent. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Supermind toaster message should be correct. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/61983f8523330e474320e1f17094d210/image.png)
![image](/uploads/227d125180d77e04c1da37f7a701bcb4/image.png)

title: Opening Superminds offer from email throws an error
description:
### Summary

Deep links from super minds emails are not working. 
Found by Bill. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds email for superminds offer.
2. Takes you to minds app. 
3. Press continue on superminds onboarding page. 
4. On superminds page, an error is throw. 

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Throws "Error. Try Again"

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should open the supermind offer

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/6dfbb41c99bb28385aa578d2a801670e/image.png)

title: Boost console: Activity posts do not appear for rejected Boosts
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The Boost console shows a history of Boosts and their status.

Completed Boosts show the activity post that was boosted.

However, Boosts that are rejected/cancelled do not show the activity post.

### Steps to reproduce

- Make a Boost
- Get rejected (e.g. due to backlog overflow)
- View the Boost console

### Platform information 

App

### App version

for a few versions

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- Activity posts do not appear for rejected Boosts

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- Activity posts appear for all Boosts, regardless of status

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/794f43d318655cea32c6ccc3785214b4/image.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Add avatar to the home feed header
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Make it easy to get to your own profile by moving the avatar on the header.

## What needs to be done

Add the avatar in the home header.

## QA

Normal testing

## UX/Design

Ideally it would be helpful a design to accommodate logo/icon with avatar in the header.
https://www.figma.com/file/nzsefF70ixE0nGAuIShnFG/Revised-Mobile-Header?node-id=0%3A1


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

GIVEN that I'm on the home screen
WHEN I press on my avatar
THEN I navigate to my profile

GIVEN that I'm on the home screen
WHEN I scroll down a lot
AND scroll up once
THEN I should see the avatar on the header
AND I should be able to click on it

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design

title: Chore: Fix all unguarded route.params occurrences across entire code-base
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Fix all unguarded route.params occurrences across entire code-base.

## What needs to be done

Search all occurrences of the `route.params.` and replace them with `route.params?.` where applicable.

Some cases: `route.params.store, route.params.entity, route.params.comment, route.params.open, route.params.options, route.params.useForSelection, route.params.query, route.params.f, route.params.plus, route.params.group, route.params.source, route.params.noBottomInset, route.params.guid, route.params.index, route.params.goBack`

## QA

Require complete testing.

## UX/Design

N/A

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Weighted
